rev.diff:
Line 4: Line 4:
== Early years ==
== Early years ==
â
[[File:DVScotty.jpg|thumb|left|upright|Scotty at the entrance to [[Scotty's Castle]], around 1935]]
 
Scott was born in [[Cynthiana, Kentucky]] to George E. Scott and his wife, Anna (Calhoun) Scott. He spent the early years of his childhood traveling with his family around the [[harness racing]] circuit, and at age 11 he left home to join his two brothers at a ranch near [[Wells, Nevada]]. In 1884, he made his first visit to Death Valley, as part of a crew [[surveying]] the [[California]]-[[Nevada]] [[border]]. At age 16, he joined [[Buffalo Bill Cody]]'s [[Wild West Show]] as a [[stunt performer|stunt rider]]. For the next 12 years, he toured the [[United States]] and [[Europe]] with the show.
Scott was born in [[Cynthiana, Kentucky]] to George E. Scott and his wife, Anna (Calhoun) Scott. He spent the early years of his childhood traveling with his family around the [[harness racing]] circuit, and at age 11 he left home to join his two brothers at a ranch near [[Wells, Nevada]]. In 1884, he made his first visit to Death Valley, as part of a crew [[surveying]] the [[California]]-[[Nevada]] [[border]]. At age 16, he joined [[Buffalo Bill Cody]]'s [[Wild West Show]] as a [[stunt performer|stunt rider]]. For the next 12 years, he toured the [[United States]] and [[Europe]] with the show.
